thread.section_title: Mariah Carey News on Infamous Singer's Boyfriend and Songs | Daily Mail Online
thread.title: fishnets and white garter James Packer break-up
thread.title_full: Mariah fishnets and white garter James Packer break-up | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.com Reporter
title: fishnets and white garter James Packer break-up
text:
She's recorded a break-up ballad called I Don't - after calling off their wedding.
And Mariah Carey rubbed further salt into the wounds between her and former fiance James Packer in a sexy wedding-themed photo for the cover.
The 46-year-old pop superstar looks busty in the sexy picture, which she shared on Tuesday and sees her wearing white and flashing a garter on her right thigh.
Scroll down for video
Making a point! Mariah Carey revealed the cover for her break-up anthem on Tuesday
The star is clad in fishnet tights as she sprawls across a Rolls Royce, in the image which she shared on Twitter.
She captioned: 'Here it is: the cover for my new song, I Don't, coming out this Friday. MC + YG.'
The Mariah's World star teased the release of the anthem on Monday on her Instagram account.
Red hot! On Monday Mariah took to Instagram to tease her new single, I Don't, ahead of its release on Friday
In the image, the mom-of-two looked red hot in a cut-out gown which hugged her figure and flashed a lot of flesh.
In the sexy promo shot, Mariah wrapped her arms around herself to draw attention to the fact that she isn't wearing a diamond on her left ring finger.
The sultry image of the songstress also featured the words: 'Mariah Carey I DON'T #4DaysIDon't.'
This comes soon after Mariah gave a glimpse of herself recording the breakup ballad on Sunday's season finale of her reality show and quickly kissed Bryan Tanaka.
The hit-maker emotionally sang I Don't after discussing her relationship with the Australian billionaire on the latest episode of Mariah's World.
'Ever since the tour wrapped I took some time just to process my feelings and I started writing a song to express what I've been going through,' she said.
Breakup ballad: The 46-year-old pop star gave a glimpse of herself recording the breakup ballad amid her split from ex-fiance James Packer on Sunday's season finale of Mariah's World
'And if you're not getting the love that you need from someone that you're supposed to be in a real relationship with, then why remain in that situation?,' she added.
The singer poured her heart into the breakup ballad that included the lyrics: ''Cause when you love someone, you just don't treat them bad, you messed up all we had. Probably think I'm coming back, but I don't, I don't.'
She then ceremoniously removed her engagement ring and left it in the booth.
Mariah's manager Stella Bulochnikov brought it to her later.
Moving on: The hit-maker quickly moved on to her backup dancer Bryan Tanaka
'I can't go though with this, I can't do it,' Mariah said of her pending wedding.
'He put you though hell, unapologetically,' Stella said sympathetically.
Mariah wasted no time jumping into a new romance with her young backing dancer Bryan Tanaka.
Hawaiian getaway: Maria and Tanaka jetted to Hawaii and smooched in the ocean
She promptly jetted to Hawaii with Tanaka to smooch in the warm ocean.
'I'm not going to have a woe is me festival,' decided Mariah, as she played with her twins, Roc and Roe, on her private plane.
'It's hard for me to express how I feel…my situation now is a deep, difficult situation,' added Mariah, who is 13 years older than 33-year-old Tanaka.
Never forget: Tanaka told Mariah that he would never forget the beautiful moments
Adding: 'It definitely feels like a weight has been lifted'.
Tanaka admitted holding a torch for his boss for years – so he was thrilled by the breakup.
'This is like a whole new start…there's no doubt I'm going to go after her with my whole heart because she's the girl of my dreams, it just feels right,' he said.
New start: The backing dancer was resolved to pursue Mariah
They later frolicked in the ocean and passionately kissed.
'This whole experience is magical to me, there's something really special going on,' he beamed.
'This is one of the most beautiful moments…that I will never forget,' he told her.
Picturesque setting: Mariah and Tanaka smooched as the sun was setting in Hawaii
'I admire this woman, I admire her, and I feel like this is the key to love,' he cooed.
'I'm really happy, I'm not sure if anyone else can understand that, but it is what it is,' smiled Mariah.
The show opened in Cape Town, South Africa with a visit to a butterfly farm and zoo.
Doting mother: The singer took her twins Roc and Roe to a butterfly farm and zoo
'It's sort of like a family,' Mariah said of her touring team.
The singer then decided to promote Tanaka to co-creative director.
'That's a huge freaking deal,' he said.
New position: Mariah promoted Tanaka to co-creative director
Anthony Burrell, the current creative director, felt 'blindsided' by the move.
'I could walk…it is kind of a slap in the face,' he complained.
'I'm not happy about this,' he grumbled, before deciding to keep his mouth shut and 'conform'.
Not happy: Anthony Burrell balked at the new co-creative director position but ultimately accepted it
Mariah then made a rare appearance in the daylight to take her kids on safari for their 5th birthday.
'I don't own flats,' she grumbled as she tottered onto the bus in five inch stilettos.
'Early is not my friend,' she remarked.
They played their last show in Johannesburg.
Last show: Mariah wrapped up her tour in Johannesburg
'I can honestly say that this is the best time I've had on tour,' she announced.
Back at home Mariah and the kids met with her ex-husband, Nick Cannon, for some trampolining.
'Me and their dad, we have a very cool and special relationship. We just have each other's back regardless, I think that's amazing and I love it,' said Mariah.
Family first: Nick Cannon was shown with ex-wife Mariah and their children
Mariah and Nick's family laughed at Nick's turban.
Back at Mariah's mansion she worked with her manager Stella on the plans for her doomed wedding to Packer.
'The prenup is taking forever…is the universe trying to tell us something?' asked Stella.
Long prenup: Stella Bulochnikov said it was taking 'forever' for the prenuptial agreement
Tanaka then dropped by for a chat and some red wine.
Mariah lay on the work surface in a corset for the discussion.
'It's perfectly normal to lie on a counter,' she breathed.
Perfectly normal: Mariah said it was normal to recline on a counter
They then headed to a party for the bat mitzvah of Stella's 12-year-old daughter Miksha.
'I'm eternally 12, but she's actually 12,' said Mariah.
Mariah took a walk with Tanaka to talk about her issues, but they ended up doing romantic 'lifts' in the garden.
Time to celebrate: Mishka was thrown a bat mitzvah that her friend Mariah attended
He tenderly smoothed down her hair which made her feel 'insecure' and she bolted to fix it but Tanaka reeled her back.
'Everybody's always judging how I look and stuff,' she said.
'Not me, I think you look beautiful,' he told her.
Dance practice: Tanaka and Mariah practiced some dance moves
'Are you really going to marry this guy?' he asked earnestly.
'I don't even know what I think anymore,' she told him.
'I just want you to be happy,' he told her.
'I don't want it to be weird between us,' she said, as he tenderly kissed her hand.
Adding: 'You make me smile'.
Big smile: Mariah admitted that Tanaka makes her smile
Meanwhile, ex-husband Nick Cannon was at Build Studio during the Build series on Tuesday promoting his new single Hold On.
He recently explained why he is wearing a turban on The Ellen Degeneres Show , saying he was wearing them to raise 'cultural understanding'.
Mariah Carey's ex sported a red turban to promote his new single after he just got back from Hawaii where he performed with Amber Rose.
Busy man: Meanwhile, ex-husband Nick Cannon was at Build Studio during the Build series on Tuesday promoting his new single Hold On
He recently explained why he is wearing a turban on the Ellen Degeneres Show, saying he was wearing them to raise 'cultural understanding'
The Hold On hitmaker, who donned sunglasses to the event, also wore a sleeveless black and red plaid shirt with a white t-shirt underneath.
He paired it with track pants that seemed to be an ode to New York City with one leg featuring the trademark 'New York' lettering and the other leg showcasing the Statue of Liberty on top of an American flag.
The sleeveless shirt allowed the host to show off his arm sleeve tattoos.
Poser! The Hold On hitmaker, who donned sunglasses to the event, also wore a sleeveless black and red plaid shirt with a white t-shirt underneath
Hitmaker: The singer, who also hosts America's Got Talent, took some time to talk to audience members who came out to support him
